Award.AwardTitle: Peep and The Big Wide World `Anywhere Math` Initiative, Season 4

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Education and Human Resources

Award.AbstractNarration:
Proposal Number: DRL 07-41644
Institution: WGBH Educational Foundation
PI: Kate Taylor
Title of Project: Peep and the Big Wide World "Anywhere Math" Season 4


WGBH Educational Foundation will produce and distribute 10 new episodes of the award-winning TV series PEEP and the Big Wide World, launching a new initiative "Anywhere Math". In addition, funds will help launch an expanded PEEP Web site, and develop and evaluate an outreach plan targeted to Native American preschoolers. PEEP's three intended impacts are to (1) engage preschoolers in science explorations that promote positive attitudes and inquiry skills, (2) empower parents to encourage and support their children's science activities and promote the ideas of "science play", and (3) provide educational resources and professional development for preschool educators via a curriculum that contributes to the emerging field of preschool science and math education. Project partners include Head Start, Science Olympiad, Countdown to Kindergarten, and the Boston Children's Museum. The series is produced by WGBH and broadcast on TLC and Discovery Kids. This upcoming season the show will also be broadcast on public television via APT. Goodman Research Group will conduct formative and summative evaluations to assess project impact.

WGBH Educational Foundation

"Peep and the Big Wide World" Season IV

Project Outcomes Report

With this project grant for "Peep and the Big Wide World" Season IV, we were able to achieve several significant accomplishments, including: broadening the Peep curriculum to include “Anywhere Math;” producing six new Peep episodes; distributing 55 episodes of Peep nationwide to public television stations and increasing their distribution of the show; reaching Spanish-speaking audiences with both the Peep programs in Spanish on V-me and educator resources in Spanish online; developing Peep’s social media presence; and continuing to enhance the educational value of Peep as a tool for teaching preschool educators. 

Through these efforts, we have had impact in the following areas:

  • We successfully broadened Peep’s curriculum with the addition of “Anywhere Math.” Building on the lessons learned from the formative evaluation of two math stories we produced in the previous season, we produced six new math stories, which our advisors assessed. Their assessment was documented by Goodman Research Group, Inc. Our advisors believed that the new Peep math stories fit well with the existing style and appeal of Peep programs, and that they conveyed the math concepts clearly and accurately. Advisors agreed the new episodes presented a strong integration of science and math within segments.
  • We significantly increased Peep’s national visibility on-air and on-line. On television, we distributed 55 episodes with unlimited releases to public television stations nationwide. Peep aired in 90% of the Top 10 markets (including V-me) and 78% of the top 50 markets (including V-me). Online, we created a social media presence for Peep through a new YouTube Channel, a Facebook page, and a Twitter account, coordinated by Peep’s online community manager.
  • We also expanded our reach by targeteing Spanish-speaking children, parents and educators with Peep’s preschool television programming and educational resources. WGBH licensed 26 Peep stories and their accompanying live-action interstitials in Spanish to V-me, the Spanish language broadcast service on public television stations around the country that is currently available in over 70% of Latino homes. (In addition to public television stations, V-me is also carried on basic cable in major markets and nationally via satellite.) Beginning in March 2010, Peep has aired as part of V-me Ninos, the most widely distributed block of children’s programming on U.S. Spanish TV.

To create an on-line presence, we also launched a new section on the Peep Web site dedicated to content in Spanish for Latino parents and caregivers. Spanish-speaking visitors to peepandthebigwideworld.com can visit the Spanish Resources page. Here, an introductory paragraph in Spanish invites parents and caregivers to join their children in science and math investigations in their everyday lives and provides them with six science themes they can explore together—shadows, water, plants, color, sound, and ramps. Each theme features an animated Peep story, related live-action video, and a Family Science letter with ideas for continuing the exploration and learning at home. Since it’s launch on the Peep Web site, these Spanish resources have received twice the number of page visits as the English resources.
